elements.title: Corporate Governance Statement - Leadership of Starvest plc

data.value: The Company Secretary role is managed by the Company’s solicitor.
The Company’s Non-Executive Director for the period to 31st August 2022 is regarded as an Independent Director.
Mr. Baxter took the role of Non-executive Chairman on 1st September 2022 and is not considered independent.
The Board evaluates its performance effectiveness based on reviews carried out at every board meeting.
Members are actively encouraged to participate in continuing professional development (CPD).

Maintain high standards of business conduct; act fairly between members of the Company; confidentiality of non-public information

Governance structures and culture are appropriate for the size and capacity of the Company.
Communicate the strategy of the Board to shareholders.
Ensure implementation and execution of the Board’s strategy.

data.value: The economic shock of the global pandemic continued throughout 2022.
The value of trading portfolio decreased ~56% due to lower market prices.
NAV and NAV per share decreased 53.4% and 53.7%, respectively.
Starvest’s market capitalisation decreased approximately 49%.
Discount to NAV narrowed to 29% compared to 34% a year ago.
Loss before tax of £7,540,842 in 2022 compared to a loss of £3,861,014 in 2021.
Company’s Net Asset Value decreased to £6.6m.
Focus on investments in gold producers.

data.value: The Company’s credit risk arises primarily from short term loans to related parties and the risk the counterparty fails to discharge its obligations. At 30 September 2022 there were no loans outstanding (2021: £nil).

Liquidity risk arises from the management of cash funds and working capital. The risk is that the Company will fail to meet its financial obligations as they fall due. The Company operates within the constraints of available funds and cash flow projections are produced and regularly reviewed by management.

data.key: Interest rate risk profile of financial assets
data.value: The only financial assets (other than short term debtors) are cash at bank and in hand, which comprises money at call. The interest earned in the year was negligible.
The Company has no material exposure to foreign currency fluctuations.
The Company is exposed to market risk in that the value of its investments would be expected to vary depending on trading activity of its shares.

This table presents a financial statement showing assets and liabilities. The main components include trade investments, dividends receivable, cash equivalents, and investment funds under assets (totaling 6,589,799 in the first period and 14,119,154 in the second period), and accruals and payables under liabilities (totaling 41,776 and 83,640 respectively). There is a notable decrease in trade investments between periods, while cash and cash equivalents showed significant increase.

elements.title: Starvest plc 2022 annual report and financial statements

data.value: Starvest plc is a Public Limited Company incorporated in England & Wales. The registered office is Salisbury House, London Wall, London, EC2M 5PS. The Company's shares are listed on the AIM market of the London Stock Exchange.
07 February 2023
The Directors are confident that adequate funding can be raised as required to meet the Company's current and future liabilities.
As at the date of this report, the Company has no borrowings.
The financial statements have been prepared in accordance with applicable United Kingdom accounting standards.
Pounds sterling
The business is inherently high risk and cyclical in nature dependent upon fluctuations in world economic activity which impacts on the demand for minerals.
The investee companies almost invariably lack share market liquidity, even if quoted on AIM, AQSE, ASX, or TSX-V.
Of the 15 to 20 investments held at any one time, it is expected that no more than five will prove to be ‘winners’.
It is the intention of the Board to recommend the distribution of up to half the profits realised when profits have been realised.
The Board recognizes accountability to Shareholders and aims to provide effective communication.
Starvest plc 2022 Annual Report and Financial Statements
Source of early-stage finance to fledgling businesses to maximize capital value and generate benefits for Shareholders in the form of capital growth and modest dividends.
Inherently high risk and cyclical business, dependent on fluctuations in world economic activity.
Of multiple investments held, no more than five will prove to be 'winners'; modest share price improvements expected from half of the remainder.
When profits have been realized, up to half the profits will be distributed.

The Board of Starvest plc are committed to the principles of good corporate governance and believe in the importance and value of robust corporate governance and in accountability to shareholders and stakeholders.
Starvest has chosen to adhere to the Quoted Company Alliance’s Corporate Governance Code for Small and Mid-Size Quoted Companies (the “QCA Code”).
The Company complies with the vast majority of the QCA Code but does not achieve full compliance with Principles 5 and 7.
Principle 5: The company currently has fewer than two independent directors; Principle 7: There are no formal evaluation procedures for individual board members.
The Board plans to address the areas of non-compliance as the Company grows by appointing additional members and potentially formal evaluation processes.
The Company is established to provide early-stage finance to fledgling businesses, especially in the natural resources sector.
Initial investments are usually not greater than £100,000.
Starvest plc
Annual Report and Financial Statements
Review management letter, responsiveness to auditor's findings, and effectiveness of external audit process.
Mark Badros
07 February 2023

elements.title: Liquidity Risk and Other Financial Management Disclosures

data.value: The Company seeks to manage financial risk, to ensure sufficient liquidity is available to meet foreseeable needs and to invest cash assets safely and profitably.
As at 30 September 2022, the Company has no borrowings (2021: £25,000 unutilised overdraft facility).
The Company trades substantially within the United Kingdom and all transactions are denominated in Sterling.
The Company is naturally exposed to market price risk, by the nature of its trade in investments.
The Directors confirm that there is no relevant audit information of which the Company’s auditor is unaware.
A resolution to appoint PKF Littlejohn LLP as auditor for the coming year will be proposed at the forthcoming AGM.
07 February 2023

elements.title: Independent Auditor’s Report on Financial Statements of Starvest PLC

data.value: We have audited the financial statements of Starvest Plc (the ‘company’) for the year ended 30 September 2022 which comprise the Statement of Comprehensive Income, the Statement of Financial Position, the Statement of Changes in Equity, the Statement of Cash Flows and notes to the financial statements.
We have concluded that the Director's use of the going concern basis of accounting in the preparation of the financial statements is appropriate.
Materiality for the company financial statements was set at £184,000 (2021: £422,000).
